snippet: A leading House Democrat is demanding information from the biggest cellphone companies in the United States about their role in helping police departments track suspects in criminal investigations.
abstract: Rep Edward J Markey, a leading House Democrat, is demanding information from the country’s biggest cellphone companies about their role in helping local police departments conduct surveillance and track suspects and others in criminal investigations; contends tracking practices may violate privacy rights.
lead_paragraph: A leading House Democrat is demanding information from the biggest cellphone companies in the United States about their role in helping police departments track suspects in criminal investigations.

headline.seo: Wireless Carriers Who Aid Police Surveillance Are Asked for Data
headline.main: Wireless Carriers Who Aid Police Are Asked for Data
headline.print_headline: Wireless Carriers Who Aid Police Are Asked for Data
